instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .
definitions.C1803: What is C1803? Capacitor to ground on RTC_RESET_L on machines from 2009-2012, RTC_RESET_L needs to be high for system to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .

threads.title: jagadish <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pm slp s4 L
threads.message:
all s5 power rails present none of the s3 <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> missing again, is there something im missing, this is the same as every 2012 board 
I was asked this before, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.37v

3.33V for both
history, sicky substance around <CAPACITOR>C3890</CAPACITOR> area

unrelated question, I have fixed almost every air board thats come through here, and around 70% of retina boards but these I rarely fix them without help, why are these such bullshit compared to the retinas and airs

threads.title: jagadish <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pm slp s4 L
threads.message: Corrosion under SMC or dead clock chip are the first suspects.

threads.title: jagadish <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pm slp s4 L
threads.message:
smc reflowed, clock chip replaced, ultrasonic, alcohol, oven to dry
<CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR> voltage 3.18
<CAPACITOR>C1803</CAPACITOR> voltage 3.23

threads.title: jagadish <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pm slp s4 L
threads.message: Check for pulsing on <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> rail, measure carefully preferably with a scope. Auto range meter will not catch these.
